quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: So many books, so little time.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
author: Stephen King

quote: There is no friend as loyal as a book.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: A book is a dream that you hold in your hand.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: The only thing you absolutely have to know is the location of the library.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.
author: David Mitchell

quote: A book is a gift you can open again and again.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled 'This could change your life.'
author: Helen Exley

quote: A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading.
author: William Styron

quote: There is no frigate like a book to take us lands away.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The person who deserves most pity is a lonesome one on a rainy day who doesn't know how to read.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Books are the mirrors of the soul.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Books open your mind, broaden your mind, and strengthen you as nothing else can.
author: William Feather

quote: A book is the only place in which you can examine a fragile thought without breaking it.
author: Edward P. Morgan

quote: I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity, and once more in old age.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination and the journey. They are home.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this.
author: Dave Eggers

quote: Books and doors are the same thing. You open them, and you go through into another world.
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: Books are lighthouses erected in the great sea of time.
author: E.P. Whipple

quote: A book worth reading is worth buying.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Books are a form of political action. Books are knowledge. Books are reflection. Books change your mind.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Books are humanity in print.
author: Barbara W. Tuchman

quote: Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.
author: Stephen Fry

quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
author: Stephen King

quote: Books are a guide in youth and an entertainment for age.
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: Books are the carriers of civilization. Without books, history is silent, literature dumb, science crippled, thought and speculation at a standstill.
author: Barbara W. Tuchman

quote: Books give a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and life to everything.
author: Plato

quote: Books support us in our solitude and keep us from being a burden to ourselves.
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: Books were my pass to personal freedom. I learned to read at age three, and soon discovered there was a whole world to conquer that went beyond our farm in Mississippi.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Books wash away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

quote: Books are the perfect entertainment: no commercials, no batteries, hours of enjoyment for each dollar spent. What I wonder is why everybody doesn’t carry a book around for those inevitable dead spots in life.
author: Stephen King

quote: Books are my friends, my companions. They make me laugh and cry and find meaning in life.
author: Christopher Paolini

quote: Books were my pass to personal freedom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Books are the blessed chloroform of the mind.
author: Robert Chambers

quote: Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination and the journey. They are home.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: Books are a narcotic.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Books are like mirrors: if a fool looks in, you cannot expect a genius to look out.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Books are the greatest companions, both in your times of loneliness and your times of company.
author: Yash Gupta

quote: Books are the compasses and telescopes and sextants and charts which other men have prepared to help us navigate the dangerous seas of human life.
author: Jesse Lee Bennett

quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
author: Stephen King

quote: Books are the building blocks of civilization.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Books are a hard-bound drug with no danger of an overdose. I am the happy victim of books.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: Books are the most wonderful friends in the world. When you meet someone and know you have a mutual love of books, you know you have something in common that will never run out.
author: Jessica Lange

quote: Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back.
author: John Green

quote: Books are the ultimate escape.
author: Alexandra Bracken

quote: Books are the flowers of the imagination.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Books are the best weapon in the world. Arm yourself.
author: Doctor Who

quote: Books are the perfect antidote to the loneliness of the human soul.
author: Emma Thompson

quote: Books are the mirrors of the soul.
author: Virginia Woolf

author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Books are the foundation of any democracy.
author: James Madison

author: Stephen King

author: Jesse Lee Bennett

quote: Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Books are the training weights of the mind.
author: Epictetus

quote: Books are like a mirror. If an ass looks in, you can’t expect an angel to look out.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer
